fields.request: Manual QA: Verify node registration accepts blank IPv6 addresses
fields.request_details: Run `python manage.py shell -c "import json; from django.test import Client; from django.urls import reverse; from nodes.models import Node; client = Client(); payload = {'hostname': 'qa-node', 'network_hostname': 'qa-node.example.com', 'port': 8123, 'mac_address': 'aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:10'}; response = client.post(reverse('register-node'), data=json.dumps(payload), content_type='application/json'); assert response.status_code == 200, response.content; node = Node.objects.get(mac_address='aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:10'); assert node.ipv6_address == '', 'IPv6 address should be stored as a blank string'; assert node.ipv4_address == '', 'IPv4 address should be stored as a blank string'; assert node.address == '', 'Address should remain blank';"` to simulate a node registration without IPv6 details. Confirm the API responds with HTTP 200 and the record saves without IntegrityError. Finally, open the Django admin Nodes changelist and verify the new node appears with empty IPv4 and IPv6 fields.
